subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to create test case to test the Android apk use 	the JUnit
msgSnippet: Kent, I m not 100% following.  If you can somehow get from your apk to something that looks like a jar, .class files, or .java files, then JUnit should work
messageBody:
Kent,

I'm not 100% following. If you can somehow get from your apk to
something that looks like a jar, .class files, or .java files, then
JUnit should work for you. It may be worth asking on an android list
how to do that extraction, if at all.

David Saff

On Thu, Aug 20, 2009 at 9:44 PM, sober60kimo<sober60kimo@...> wrote:
> Hi David Saff,
>
> I don't know.
> So have to use java classes to read out of an Android apk file at all. (Include the *.java, source, layout...etc files)
> Then we can create JUnit project to test via this java classes, right?
>
> Regards,
> Kent Wang
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <david@...> wrote:
>>
>> sober60kimo,
>>
>> Sounds like you have a hard task ahead of you.  Do you know whether
>> java classes can be read out of an apk file at all?
>>
>>    David Saff
>>
>> On Wed, Aug 19, 2009 at 8:50 PM, sober60kimo<sober60kimo@...> wrote:
>> > Hi,
>> >
>> > I only have an Anroid apk then want to create JUnit test case to test.
>> > How to create test case of JUnit project to test the it?
>> > Or can't use in only apk file to test, must have the source code of this file?
>> >
>> > Thanks,
>> >
>> >
